channel.title: 474 Webclient invalidhost error!

item.title: 474 Webclient invalidhost error!
item.dc:creator: @jyrmaz jyrmaz
item.description:
@jyrmaz wrote:

xX4m4zingXx:

i think you need something like the ip of your computer and this ip isn’t done 192.168.1.

even if i change this

public boolean method15(int i) { anInt31++; String string = getDocumentBase().getHost().toLowerCase(); if (string.equals("jagex.com") || string.endsWith(".jagex.com")) return true; if (string.equals("runescape.com") || string.endsWith(".runescape.com")) return true; if (i != 11641) windowOpened(null); if (string.endsWith(Signlink.serverIp)) return true; for (/**/; (string.length() > 0 && (string.charAt(string.length() + -1) ^ 0xffffffff) <= -49 && (string .charAt(-1 + string.length()) ^ 0xffffffff) >= -58); string = string .substring(0, string.length() - 1)) { /* empty */ } if (string.endsWith("192.168.1.")) return true; method16("invalidhost", i ^ 0x2d78); return false; }

to

public boolean method15(int i) { anInt31++; return true; }
doesnt work.. and jar does work!

but when it does have that it just doesnt connect. and still… jar works!

Read full topic

item.title: 474 Webclient invalidhost error!
item.dc:creator: @jyrmaz jyrmaz
item.description:
@jyrmaz wrote:

Here’s client download link(client doesnt have cache downloader): https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/100387859/Client.zip

I DO HAVE CACHE DOWNLOADER AND WORKING (cache goes to user home)
JARRED CLIENT DOES WORK FINE!
NOT JARRED CLIENT DOES WORK!

But when try to load jarred client with html it says “invalidhost.ws”

I think this is the reason to this:

public boolean method15(int i) { anInt31++; String string = getDocumentBase().getHost().toLowerCase(); if (string.equals("jagex.com") || string.endsWith(".jagex.com")) return true; if (string.equals("runescape.com") || string.endsWith(".runescape.com")) return true; if (i != 11641) windowOpened(null); if (string.endsWith(Signlink.serverIp)) return true; for (/**/; (string.length() > 0 && (string.charAt(string.length() + -1) ^ 0xffffffff) <= -49 && (string .charAt(-1 + string.length()) ^ 0xffffffff) >= -58); string = string .substring(0, string.length() - 1)) { /* empty */ } if (string.endsWith("192.168.1.")) return true; method16("invalidhost", i ^ 0x2d78); return false; }

Problem is NOT cache or server is not online

Read full topic
